result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin Michelle James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will waive costs and surcharges (including DNA) due to excess sentence served by the defendant.
Court ordered DNA sample to be taken.

With credit for 54 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Concurrent with: any sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin Michelle James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 54 (fifty-four) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered DNA sample to be taken. Court will waive costs and surcharges (including DNA) due to excess sentence served by the defendant.
.
Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
.
20 day appeal rights given,

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Robin Michelle James in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Student Intern Colin Stevenson under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered stayed warrant withdrawn at today's proceedings.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed dated 04-13-2016.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is currently in St. Luke's Hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until Plea and Sentencing and Calendar Call.  Court ordered case adjourned for Projected Guilty Plea/Sentencing and Calendar Call in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 25, 2016; received and filed.

Court referred defendant to the Justice Point program for assessment and treatment.  Court ordered Absolute Sobriety and No Firearms/Dangerous Weapons.
Justice Point referral, received and filed.

Defendant Robin Michelle James in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Riflej, Branch 31.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Robin Michelle James in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Robin Michelle James in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated August 28, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program discharge summary received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: KAR
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.

Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer appeared earlier this date.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  REMAND TO COMMISSIONER
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Justice Point Program violation report: Missed office contact on August 6, 2015; received and filed. Court and state reviewed violation and no action at this time.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAIL Group Home, Tony F. or Hilda W.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robin Michelle James in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Robin Michelle James in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Doctor's report return. 

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Robin Michelle James not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Doctor's report return. For reasons stated on the record as to defendant being produced.   Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's report return in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Student Intern Larissa Dallman under the student practice rule supervised by Attorney Calvin Malone for Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Robin Michelle James not in court, in custody at Criminal Justice Faciltity and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Doctor's report return. Defense counsel is in jury trial in another court for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's report return in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Robin Michelle James in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Robin Michelle James in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.   

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
